questions.text: What is the abnormality noted in the Given CT scan?
What is the abnormality shown in this shoulder Radiograph?
questions.solution: • Electric Bulb/Light Bulb Appearance on Shoulder Radiograph Is suggestive of posterior Dislocation Of Shoulder.

questions.text: A Young Female with Hypertension Shows the following angiographic findings, Probable Diagnosis is?
questions.solution:
• Fibromuscular dysplasia is a characterised by an idiopathic, non-inflammatory,non-atherosclerotic angiopathy of small and medium-sized arteries.

More common in young women, typically diagnosed between the ages of 30 and 50



  • Arterial imaging with CT angiography, MR angiography and digital subtraction angiography (DSA) may be used to visualise the lesions in fibromuscular dysplasia.
  • DSA is the gold standard.The characteristic finding is alternating stenoses and dilatations, causing a string of beads appearance.

questions.text: Half life of 18F used in Pet scan is
Which of the following water soluble radiocontrast agent has highest osmolality?
questions.solution:
TYPES OF RADIOCONTRAST MEDIA

The RCM agents currently in use are based upon fully substituted benzoic acid molecules with three atoms of iodine replacing the hydrogen atoms at positions 2, 4, and 6 of the benzene ring. The different agents can be classified based upon three

properties :

  • The charge of the iodinated molecule (ionic or nonionic)
  • The molecular structure (monomeric or dimeric)
  • The osmolality of the injected preparation (hyperosmolal, low osmolal, or isoosmolal relative to normal serum osmolality [275 to 290 mosm/kg])

questions.text: What is the type of fracture shown here?
questions.solution: Hangman fracture/Traumatic Spondylolisthesis of Axis(C2) is a fracture which involves both pars interarticularis of the C2 vertebra . It is typically the result of a hyperextension and distraction injury.

questions.text: What is the type of fracture shown here?
questions.solution:
• Jefferson Fracture is Burst Fracture Of C1
  • This fracture is caused by a compressive downward force that is transmitted evenly through the occipital condyles to the superior articular surfaces of the lateral masses of C1

questions.text: A 52 year old woman with exertional dyspnea, recurrent transient ischemic attacks, light headedness with sudden changes in position and a 7 kg weight loss over the past 6 months, undergoes Cardiact CT Scan. The Given CT Scan is suggestive of?
questions.solution:
• The CT shows a large left atrial mass attached to interatrial septum
  • Atrial Myxomas are the most common primary cardiac tumors in adults.
  • Rhabdomyomas in children
  • Majority of Cardiac Myxomas are in left atrium,usually attached to interatrial septum and may show calcifications
  • Carney complex is a autosomal dominant condition with blue nevi and multiple cardiac myxomas along with other multiple endocrine neoplasms

questions.text: The Given Chest radiograph suggests the diagnosis of
questions.solution: Leather bottle/waterbottle/money bag appearance on cxr=Pericardial effusion

questions.text: A Skull radiograph of Child with seizures and mental retardation is shown, probable diagnosis?
Following Ct scan Image Suggests?
questions.solution: • Hyperdense MCA sign refers to focal increased density of the middle cerebral artery (MCA) on CT and is a direct visualization of thromboembolic material within the lumen,Suggestive of Acute Mca THROMBUS

questions.text: A Ct Angiogram image of a child with high output cardiac failure is given,it suggests the diagnosis of?
questions.solution: • CT cerebral angiogram shows an aneurysmal deep venous structure which drains to the vein of Galen, The posterior part of the superior sagittal sinus, the transverse and sigmoid sinuses are also enlarged. Feeding arteries are multiple, dilated and tortuous attaching directly to the aneurysm area

questions.text: 25 year old young male presenting with abdominal pain after sustaining blunt trauma to his abdomen during a road traffic accident, has a BP-120/80 and a pulse of 72bpm,The next best step in management of this patient is?
questions.solution:
• Initial Investigation in a patient with abdominal trauma Usg to detect hemoperitoneum
  • Investigation of choice to know the source of hemoperitoneum in a stable patient is Cect-Abdomen

The next line of management in this patient should be to do FAST(USG)

questions.text: Myocardial Viability is best evaluated by?
questions.solution:
• Thallium-201,Sestamibi,Tetrofosmin scan are suggestive of Myocardial Perfusion Imaging
  • Pyrophosphate scan of Myocardial Infarction.
  • 18FDG Pet is used to detect Myocardial Viability

questions.text: All lung carcinomas for diagnosis requires CECT thorax but MRI is useful in which of the following-
questions.solution:
• Pancoast Tumors are Lung Cancers located at apicopleuropulmonary groove(superior sulcus)
  • MRI is preferred in the evaluation of Pancoast tumor especially to evaluate tumor extension into brachial plexus,subclavian vessels,pleural and neurovertebral foramina and spinal cord involvement

questions.text: Gamma Rays are used in?
questions.solution:
• PET Scan uses Gamma Rays
  • Gamma Rays are used in SCINTIGRAPHY STUDIES(Tc99m radioisotope studies).SPECT(Single Photon Emission Computerised Tomography) studies and PET scan (Positron Emission Tomography)
  • All other investigations given in the options use X rays

questions.text: Photostimulable Phosphor Plate is used in
questions.solution:
• Photostimulable Phosphor Plate is used in Computerised Radiography
  • Conventional X ray Film is made of emulsions of Silver Halide mainly Silver Bromide.

questions.text: Identify the investigation done?
Nuchal Translucency scan is done at?
questions.solution:
• Nuchal translucency (NT) is the sonographic appearance of a collection of fluid under the skin behind the fetal neck in the first-trimester of pregnancy
  • In fetuses with chromosomal abnormalities cardiac defects and many genetic syndromes the NT thickness is incrased
  • Screening by NT can detect about 80% of fetuses with trisomy 21 and other major aneuploides
  • The gestational periods must be 11 to 13 weeks and six days
  • The fetel crown – rump length should be between 45 and 84mm

questions.text: Incorrect statement regarding the condition given in image is?
A case of Allergic Rhinitis, NCCT image of Paranasal air sinuses shows an appearance known as?
questions.solution: • NCCT of the paranasal sinuses shows inhomogenous soft tissue opacity in the left maxillary antrum extrum extending into the nasal cavity with a double density sign having few hyperdense areas and thickened hypodense mucosa suggestive of Alleric Fungal sinusitis.

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman has been admitted to the Intensive Therapy Unit (ITU) with severe pancreatitis. She is currently being ventilated but has worsening respiratory failure, refractory to oxygen therapy. In addition, she has a normal capillary wedge pressure. Which of the following is the most likely radiological feature on portable CXR?
questions.solution:
Direct and indirect insults to the lung can result in increased permeability of the pulmonary vasculature allowing protein-rich fluid to pass into the alveolar spaces at normal hydrostatic pressures. ARDS is the more severe form of this disease and the earliest radiographic findings are patchy ill-defined airspace opacities in both lungs.

Reference: Grainger & Allison's 5e, pp 390-391.

questions.text: A 4 day old neonate presents with bile stained vomiting. Gastric dilatation is seen on an abdominal radiograph. What is the most likely cause of these abnormalities?
questions.solution: Unless it is treated in a timely manner, bowel strangulation results in an ischemic loss of extensive bowel, causing the short-gut syndrome. Most patients with midgut malrotation develop volvulus within the first week of life. Bilious vomiting is the initial symptom, but abdominal distention is not remarkable.

questions.text: A 35 year old female is highly suspected of pulmonary embolism. A CT pulmonary angiography (CTPA) is considered. Which of the following risks is not relevant?
questions.solution: Pneumothorax is a rare complication of pulmonary embolism. Where there is a suggestive history, clinicians might consider pulmonary embolism as an underlying mechanism for the development of a pneumothorax. The seemingly low incidence would not support routine CT angiography in all patients with a pneumothorax

choices.text: History of previous allergic reaction to iodinated contrast agents

questions.text: An MRI of brain is requested for a patient suspected of metastatic cancer. Which of the following pieces of clinical information is a contraindication to MRI?
questions.solution: Absolute contraindications: The cardiac implantable electronic device (CIED) such as pacemakers, implantable cardioverter defibrillators (ICDs) and cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) devices: Patients with CIED are at risk for inappropriate device therapy, device heating/movement, and arrhythmia during MRI

choices.text: Tell her that verbal consent is all that is needed
Ask her to sign the form but leave the complications as blank
Ask the radiologist performing the procedure to obtain consent
Send her to the radiology department without further explanation
